snippet: Rimsha Masih has been detained in a high-security prison since mid-August, when Muslim neighbors accused her of burning a textbook used to teach the Koran to children.
abstract: Pakistani Justice Muhammad Azam Khan grants bail to Rimsha Masih, Christan girl accused of burning a textbook used to teach the Koran; ruling is significant step in a controversy that has renewed scrutiny of Pakistan's blasphemy laws.

byline.original: By DECLAN WALSH and SALMAN MASOOD

lead_paragraph: Rimsha Masih has been detained in a high-security prison since mid-August, when Muslim neighbors accused her of burning a textbook used to teach the Koran to children.

headline.seo: Christian Pakistani Girl Is Granted Bail in Blasphemy Case
headline.main: Girl Released in Pakistan Blasphemy Case
headline.print_headline: Bail for Girl In Pakistan Facing Charge Of Blasphemy

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
